refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: standard deviation The stdev operator takes a set of scalar values from an array attribute and returns the standard deviation of those values.

note.para: The stdev operator provides the same functionality as the stdev aggregate. For details, see the stdev aggregate reference.

informalexample.para: This example finds the standard deviation of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para: Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3: --afl CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0]; --show-output=no
Store values of random values between 0 and 1 in m3x3: --afl store(build(m3x3,random()%9/10.0),m3x3); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes --show-output-in-test-file=no
Select the standard deviation of each row of m3x3: --afl stdev(m3x3,val,i); --output-format=dense --show-output-in-test-file=no
